title: Loops in Java

explanation.short: Java has for loops, while loops, do-while loops, and enhanced for loops (for-each).
explanation.detailed: Java provides multiple loop types: traditional for loop with initialization, condition, and update; while loop that checks condition first; do-while loop that executes at least once; and enhanced for loop (for-each) for iterating collections and arrays. All loops support break and continue statements.

key_points: Traditional for loop: for(init; condition; update)
Enhanced for loop: for(Type item : collection)
while loop checks condition before executing
Use 'continue' to skip to next iteration
Semicolons required in traditional for loop

loop_types.use_case: When you know exact number of iterations
When loop must execute at least once

best_practices: Use enhanced for loop for arrays/collections when possible
Initialize loop variable with appropriate type
Avoid modifying loop counter inside loop body
Use meaningful variable names, not just i, j, k
Keep loop bodies short and focused

common_mistakes.explanation: Forgot to update loop variable, causing infinite loop
Extra semicolon creates empty loop body
Cannot modify collection during enhanced for loop
